metadata.name: Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) Managed Clusters
metadata.description: This module deploys an Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) Managed Cluster.
Required. The name of the agent pool.
Optional. The availability zones of the agent pool.
Optional. The number of agents (VMs) to host docker containers. Allowed values must be in the range of 1 to 100 (inclusive).
Optional. AKS will associate the specified agent pool with the Capacity Reservation Group.
Optional. The source resource ID to create the agent pool from.
Optional. Whether to enable auto-scaling for the agent pool.
Optional. Whether to enable encryption at host for the agent pool.
Optional. Whether to enable FIPS for the agent pool.
Optional. Whether to enable node public IP for the agent pool.
Optional. Whether to enable Ultra SSD for the agent pool.
Optional. Represents the Gateway node pool configuration.
Optional. The GPU instance profile of the agent pool.
Optional. GPU settings.
Optional. Host group resource ID.
Optional. Kubelet configuration on agent pool nodes.
Optional. The kubelet disk type of the agent pool.
Optional. The Linux OS configuration of the agent pool.
Optional. Local DNS configuration.
Optional. A message of the day will be a multi-line message that is prepended to the command prompt and the SSH login message.
Optional. The maximum number of agents (VMs) to host docker containers. Allowed values must be in the range of 1 to 100 (inclusive).
Optional. The minimum number of agents (VMs) to host docker containers. Allowed values must be in the range of 1 to 100 (inclusive).
Optional. The maximum number of pods that can run on a node.
Optional. The minimum number of pods that can run on a node.
Optional. The mode of the agent pool.
Optional. Network profile to be used for agent pool nodes.
Optional. The node labels of the agent pool.
Optional. The node public IP prefix ID of the agent pool.
Optional. The node taints of the agent pool.
Optional. The Kubernetes version of the agent pool.
Optional. The OS disk size in GB of the agent pool.
Optional. The OS disk type of the agent pool.
Optional. The OS SKU of the agent pool.
Optional. The OS type of the agent pool.
Optional. Pod IP allocation mode.
Optional. The pod subnet ID of the agent pool.
Optional. Power State of the agent pool.
Optional. The proximity placement group resource ID of the agent pool.
Optional. The scale down mode of the agent pool.
Optional. The scale set eviction policy of the agent pool.
Optional. The scale set priority of the agent pool.
Optional. The security settings of an agent pool.
Optional. The spot max price of the agent pool.
Optional. The tags of the agent pool.
Optional. The type of the agent pool.
Optional. Upgrade settings.
Optional. The VM size of the agent pool.
Optional. Virtual Machines resource status.
Optional. The VNet subnet ID of the agent pool.
Optional. The workload runtime of the agent pool.
Optional. The Windows profile of the agent pool.
Optional. The enable default telemetry of the agent pool.
The type for an agent pool.
Optional. The name of the extension.
Optional. Namespace where the extension Release must be placed.
Optional. Namespace where the extension will be created for an Namespace scoped extension.
Optional. The release train of the extension.
Optional. The configuration protected settings of the extension.
Optional. The configuration settings of the extension.
Optional. The version of the extension.
Optional. The flux configurations of the extension.
The type for an extension.
Required. Name of maintenance window.
Required. Maintenance window for the maintenance configuration.
Optional. Time slots on which upgrade is not allowed.
Optional. Time slots during the week when planned maintenance is allowed to proceed.
The type of a mainenance configuration.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
An AVM-aligned type for a diagnostic setting. To be used if both logs & metrics are supported by the resource provider.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. Specify the notes of the lock.
An AVM-aligned type for a lock.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource. Required if a user assigned identity is used for encryption.
An AVM-aligned type for a managed identity configuration. To be used if both a system-assigned & user-assigned identities are supported by the resource provider.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Required. Specifies the name of the AKS cluster.
Optional. Specifies the location of AKS cluster. It picks up Resource Group's location by default.
Optional. Specifies the DNS prefix specified when creating the managed cluster.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource. Only one type of identity is supported: system-assigned or user-assigned, but not both.
Optional. Advanced Networking profile for enabling observability and security feature suite on a cluster. For more information see https://aka.ms/aksadvancednetworking.
Optional. The IP families used for the cluster.
Optional. NAT Gateway profile for the cluster.
Optional. Network mode used for building the Kubernetes network.
Optional. Network dataplane used in the Kubernetes cluster. Not compatible with kubenet network plugin.
Optional. Specifies the network plugin used for building Kubernetes network.
Optional. Network plugin mode used for building the Kubernetes network. Not compatible with kubenet network plugin.
Optional. Specifies the network policy used for building Kubernetes network. - calico or azure.
Optional. Specifies the CIDR notation IP range from which to assign pod IPs when kubenet is used.
Optional. A CIDR notation IP range from which to assign service cluster IPs. It must not overlap with any Subnet IP ranges.

Optional. The CIDR notation IP ranges from which to assign service cluster IPs. One IPv4 CIDR is expected for single-stack networking. Two CIDRs, one for each IP family (IPv4/IPv6), is expected for dual-stack networking. They must not overlap with any Subnet IP ranges.

Optional. The CIDR notation IP ranges from which to assign pod IPs. One IPv4 CIDR is expected for single-stack networking. Two CIDRs, one for each IP family (IPv4/IPv6), is expected for dual-stack networking.
Optional. Static egress gateway profile for the cluster.
Optional. Specifies the IP address assigned to the Kubernetes DNS service. It must be within the Kubernetes service address range specified in serviceCidr.
Optional. Specifies the sku of the load balancer used by the virtual machine scale sets used by nodepools.
Optional. Outbound IP Count for the Load balancer.
Optional. The desired number of allocated SNAT ports per VM. Default is 0, which results in Azure dynamically allocating ports.
Optional. Desired outbound flow idle timeout in minutes.
Optional. A list of the resource IDs of the public IP addresses to use for the load balancer outbound rules.
Optional. A list of the resource IDs of the public IP prefixes to use for the load balancer outbound rules.
Optional. The type of the managed inbound Load Balancer BackendPool.
Optional. Specifies outbound (egress) routing method.
Optional. Name of a managed cluster SKU.
Optional. Tier of a managed cluster SKU.
Optional. Version of Kubernetes specified when creating the managed cluster.
Optional. The profile for Linux VMs in the Managed Cluster.
Optional. Enable Azure Active Directory integration.
Conditional. Information about a service principal identity for the cluster to use for manipulating Azure APIs. Required if no managed identities are assigned to the cluster.
Optional. Whether to enable Kubernetes Role-Based Access Control.
Optional. If set to true, getting static credentials will be disabled for this cluster. This must only be used on Managed Clusters that are AAD enabled.
Optional. Node provisioning settings that apply to the whole cluster.
Optional. Name of the resource group containing agent pool nodes.
Optional. The node resource group configuration profile.
Optional. The access profile for managed cluster API server.
Optional. Allow or deny public network access for AKS.
Required. Properties of the primary agent pool.
Optional. Define one or more secondary/additional agent pools.
Optional. Maintenance configurations for the managed cluster.
Optional. Specifies whether the cost analysis add-on is enabled or not. If Enabled `enableStorageProfileDiskCSIDriver` is set to true as it is needed.
Optional. Specifies whether the httpApplicationRouting add-on is enabled or not.
Optional. Specifies whether the webApplicationRoutingEnabled add-on is enabled or not.
Optional. Specifies the resource ID of connected DNS zone. It will be ignored if `webApplicationRoutingEnabled` is set to `false`.
Optional. Ingress type for the default NginxIngressController custom resource. It will be ignored if `webApplicationRoutingEnabled` is set to `false`.

Optional. Specifies whether assing the DNS zone contributor role to the cluster service principal. It will be ignored if `webApplicationRoutingEnabled` is set to `false` or `dnsZoneResourceId` not provided.
Optional. Specifies whether the ingressApplicationGateway (AGIC) add-on is enabled or not.
Conditional. Specifies the resource ID of connected application gateway. Required if `ingressApplicationGatewayEnabled` is set to `true`.
Optional. Specifies whether the aciConnectorLinux add-on is enabled or not.
Optional. Specifies whether the azurepolicy add-on is enabled or not. For security reasons, this setting should be enabled.
Optional. Specifies whether the openServiceMesh add-on is enabled or not.
Optional. Specifies the azure policy version to use.
Optional. Specifies whether the kubeDashboard add-on is enabled or not.
Optional. Specifies whether the KeyvaultSecretsProvider add-on is enabled or not.
Optional. Specifies whether the KeyvaultSecretsProvider add-on uses secret rotation.
Optional. Parameters to be applied to the cluster-autoscaler when enabled.
Optional. The auto upgrade configuration.

Optional. The pod identity profile of the Managed Cluster. See [use AAD pod identity](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/aks/use-azure-ad-pod-identity) for more details on AAD pod identity integration.
Optional. Whether the The OIDC issuer profile of the Managed Cluster is enabled.
Optional. Security profile for the managed cluster.
Optional. Whether the AzureBlob CSI Driver for the storage profile is enabled.
Optional. Whether the AzureDisk CSI Driver for the storage profile is enabled.
Optional. Whether the AzureFile CSI Driver for the storage profile is enabled.
Optional. Whether the snapshot controller for the storage profile is enabled.
Optional. The support plan for the Managed Cluster.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. Specifies whether the OMS agent is enabled.
Optional. Specifies whether the OMS agent is using managed identity authentication.
Optional. Resource ID of the monitoring log analytics workspace.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. The Resource ID of the disk encryption set to use for enabling encryption at rest. For security reasons, this value should be provided.
Optional. Settings and configurations for the flux extension.
Optional. Configurations for provisioning the cluster with HTTP proxy servers.
Optional. Identities associated with the cluster.
Optional. Workload Auto-scaler profile for the managed cluster.
Optional. Azure Monitor addon profiles for monitoring the managed cluster.
Optional. Service mesh profile for a managed cluster.
Optional. AI toolchain operator settings that apply to the whole cluster.
Optional. Profile of the cluster bootstrap configuration.
Optional. The FQDN subdomain of the private cluster with custom private dns zone. This cannot be updated once the Managed Cluster has been created.
Optional. Settings for upgrading the cluster with override options.
Optional. The profile for Windows VMs in the Managed Cluster.

variables.formattedUserAssignedIdentities: [reduce(map(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createArray()), lambda('id', createObject(format('{0}', lambdaVariables('id')), createObject()))), createObject(), lambda('cur', 'next', union(lambdaVariables('cur'), lambdaVariables('next'))))]
variables.identity: [if(not(empty(parameters('managedIdentities'))), createObject('type', if(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'systemAssigned'), false()), 'SystemAssigned', if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createObject()))), 'UserAssigned', null())), 'userAssignedIdentities', if(not(empty(variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'))), variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'), null())), null())]

networkProfile.loadBalancerProfile: [if(not(equals(parameters('outboundType'), 'userDefinedRouting')), createObject('allocatedOutboundPorts', parameters('allocatedOutboundPorts'), 'idleTimeoutInMinutes', parameters('idleTimeoutInMinutes'), 'managedOutboundIPs', if(not(equals(parameters('managedOutboundIPCount'), 0)), createObject('count', parameters('managedOutboundIPCount')), null()), 'backendPoolType', parameters('backendPoolType'), 'outboundIPPrefixes', if(not(empty(parameters('outboundPublicIPPrefixResourceIds'))), createObject('publicIPPrefixes', map(coalesce(parameters('outboundPublicIPPrefixResourceIds'), createArray()), lambda('id', createObject('id', lambdaVariables('id'))))), null()), 'outboundIPs', if(not(empty(parameters('outboundPublicIPResourceIds'))), createObject('publicIPs', map(coalesce(parameters('outboundPublicIPResourceIds'), createArray()), lambda('id', createObject('id', lambdaVariables('id'))))), null())), null())]

properties.notes: [coalesce(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'notes'), if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.'))]

metadata.name: Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) Managed Cluster Maintenance Configurations
metadata.description: This module deploys an Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) Managed Cluster Maintenance Configurations.
Required. Maintenance window for the maintenance configuration.
Optional. Time slots on which upgrade is not allowed.
Optional. Time slots during the week when planned maintenance is allowed to proceed.
Conditional. The name of the parent managed cluster. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. Name of the maintenance configuration.
The name of the maintenance configuration.
The resource ID of the maintenance configuration.
The resource group the agent pool was deployed into.

metadata.name: Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) Managed Cluster Agent Pools
metadata.description: This module deploys an Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) Managed Cluster Agent Pool.
Conditional. The name of the parent managed cluster. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the agent pool.
Optional. The list of Availability zones to use for nodes. This can only be specified if the AgentPoolType property is "VirtualMachineScaleSets".

Optional. Desired Number of agents (VMs) specified to host docker containers. Allowed values must be in the range of 0 to 1000 (inclusive) for user pools and in the range of 1 to 1000 (inclusive) for system pools. The default value is 1.
Optional. AKS will associate the specified agent pool with the Capacity Reservation Group.
Optional. This is the ARM ID of the source object to be used to create the target object.
Optional. Whether to enable auto-scaler.
Optional. This is only supported on certain VM sizes and in certain Azure regions. For more information, see: /azure/aks/enable-host-encryption. For security reasons, this setting should be enabled.
Optional. See Add a FIPS-enabled node pool (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/use-multiple-node-pools#add-a-fips-enabled-node-pool-preview) for more details.

Optional. Some scenarios may require nodes in a node pool to receive their own dedicated public IP addresses. A common scenario is for gaming workloads, where a console needs to make a direct connection to a cloud virtual machine to minimize hops. For more information see assigning a public IP per node (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/use-multiple-node-pools#assign-a-public-ip-per-node-for-your-node-pools).
Optional. Whether to enable UltraSSD.
Optional. Profile specific to a managed agent pool in Gateway mode. Ignored if agent pool mode is not Gateway.
Optional. GPUInstanceProfile to be used to specify GPU MIG instance profile for supported GPU VM SKU.
Optional. GPU settings.

Optional. This is of the form /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourcegroups/{resourcegroupname}/providers/microsoft.compute/hostgroups/{hostgroupname}. For more information see [Azure Dedicated Hosts](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/virtual-machines/dedicated-hosts).
Optional. Kubelet configuration on agent pool nodes.
Optional. Determines the placement of emptyDir volumes, container runtime data root, and Kubelet ephemeral storage.
Optional. Linux OS configuration.
Optional. Local DNS configuration.
Optional. A message of the day will be a multi-line message that is prepended to the command prompt and the SSH login message. You can use escape characters like \n for new line.
Optional. The maximum number of nodes for auto-scaling.
Optional. The maximum number of pods that can run on a node.
Optional. The minimum number of nodes for auto-scaling.
Optional. A cluster must have at least one "System" Agent Pool at all times. For additional information on agent pool restrictions and best practices, see: /azure/aks/use-system-pools.
Optional. Network profile to be used for agent pool nodes.
Optional. The node labels to be persisted across all nodes in agent pool.
Optional. ResourceId of the node PublicIPPrefix.
Optional. The taints added to new nodes during node pool create and scale. For example, key=value:NoSchedule.

Optional. As a best practice, you should upgrade all node pools in an AKS cluster to the same Kubernetes version. The node pool version must have the same major version as the control plane. The node pool minor version must be within two minor versions of the control plane version. The node pool version cannot be greater than the control plane version. For more information see upgrading a node pool (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/use-multiple-node-pools#upgrade-a-node-pool).
Optional. OS Disk Size in GB to be used to specify the disk size for every machine in the master/agent pool. If you specify 0, it will apply the default osDisk size according to the vmSize specified.

Optional. The default is "Ephemeral" if the VM supports it and has a cache disk larger than the requested OSDiskSizeGB. Otherwise, defaults to "Managed". May not be changed after creation. For more information see Ephemeral OS (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/cluster-configuration#ephemeral-os).

Optional. Specifies the OS SKU used by the agent pool. The default is Ubuntu if OSType is Linux. The default is Windows2019 when Kubernetes <= 1.24 or Windows2022 when Kubernetes >= 1.25 if OSType is Windows.
Optional. The operating system type. The default is Linux.
Optional. Pod IP allocation mode.

Optional. Subnet resource ID for the pod IPs. If omitted, pod IPs are statically assigned on the node subnet (see vnetSubnetID for more details). This is of the form: /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/{virtualNetworkName}/subnets/{subnetName}.
Optional. The ID for the Proximity Placement Group.
Optional. Power State of the agent pool.
Optional. Describes how VMs are added to or removed from Agent Pools. See [billing states](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/states-billing).
Optional. The eviction policy specifies what to do with the VM when it is evicted. The default is Delete. For more information about eviction see spot VMs.
Optional. The Virtual Machine Scale Set priority.
Optional. The security settings of an agent pool.

Optional. Possible values are any decimal value greater than zero or -1 which indicates the willingness to pay any on-demand price. For more details on spot pricing, see spot VMs pricing (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/spot-vms#pricing).
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. The type of Agent Pool.
Optional. Upgrade settings.

Optional. VM size. VM size availability varies by region. If a node contains insufficient compute resources (memory, cpu, etc) pods might fail to run correctly. For more details on restricted VM sizes, see: /azure/aks/quotas-skus-regions.

Optional. Node Subnet ID. If this is not specified, a VNET and subnet will be generated and used. If no podSubnetID is specified, this applies to nodes and pods, otherwise it applies to just nodes. This is of the form: /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/{virtualNetworkName}/subnets/{subnetName}.
Optional. Determines the type of workload a node can run.
Optional. Windows OS configuration.
Optional. Virtual Machines resource status.
The name of the agent pool.
The resource ID of the agent pool.
The resource group the agent pool was deployed into.

metadata.name: Kubernetes Configuration Extensions
metadata.description: This module deploys a Kubernetes Configuration Extension.
Required. The name of the Flux Configuration.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Required. The name of the AKS cluster that should be configured.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. The type of cluster to configure. Choose between AKS managed cluster or Arc-enabled connected cluster.
Optional. Configuration settings that are sensitive, as name-value pairs for configuring this extension.
Optional. Configuration settings, as name-value pairs for configuring this extension.
Required. Type of the extension, of which this resource is an instance of. It must be one of the Extension Types registered with Microsoft.KubernetesConfiguration by the extension publisher.
Optional. ReleaseTrain this extension participates in for auto-upgrade (e.g. Stable, Preview, etc.) - only if autoUpgradeMinorVersion is "true".
Optional. Namespace where the extension Release must be placed, for a Cluster scoped extension. If this namespace does not exist, it will be created.
Optional. Namespace where the extension will be created for an Namespace scoped extension. If this namespace does not exist, it will be created.
Optional. Version of the extension for this extension, if it is "pinned" to a specific version.
Optional. A list of flux configuraitons.

metadata.name: Kubernetes Configuration Flux Configurations
metadata.description: This module deploys a Kubernetes Configuration Flux Configuration.
Required. The name of the Flux Configuration.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Required. The name of the AKS cluster that should be configured.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. The type of cluster to configure. Choose between AKS managed cluster or Arc-enabled connected cluster.
Conditional. Parameters to reconcile to the GitRepository source kind type. Required if `sourceKind` is `Bucket`.
Optional. Key-value pairs of protected configuration settings for the configuration.
Conditional. Parameters to reconcile to the GitRepository source kind type. Required if `sourceKind` is `GitRepository`.
Conditional. Parameters to reconcile to the GitRepository source kind type. Required if `sourceKind` is `OciRepository`.
Conditional. Parameters to reconcile to the GitRepository source kind type. Required if `sourceKind` is `AzureBlob`.
Required. Array of kustomizations used to reconcile the artifact pulled by the source type on the cluster.
Required. The namespace to which this configuration is installed to. Maximum of 253 lower case alphanumeric characters, hyphen and period only.
Required. Scope at which the configuration will be installed.
Required. Source Kind to pull the configuration data from.
Optional. Reconciliation wait duration (ISO 8601 format).
Optional. Whether this configuration should suspend its reconciliation of its kustomizations and sources.
The name of the flux configuration.
The resource ID of the flux configuration.
The name of the resource group the flux configuration was deployed into.
The name of the extension.
The resource ID of the extension.
The name of the resource group the extension was deployed into.
The resource ID of the managed cluster.
The resource group the managed cluster was deployed into.
The name of the managed cluster.
The control plane FQDN of the managed cluster.
The principal ID of the system assigned identity.
The Client ID of the AKS identity.
The Object ID of the AKS identity.
The Resource ID of the AKS identity.
The Object ID of the OMS agent identity.
The Object ID of the Key Vault Secrets Provider identity.
The Client ID of the Key Vault Secrets Provider identity.
The Object ID of Application Gateway Ingress Controller (AGIC) identity.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The OIDC token issuer URL.
The addonProfiles of the Kubernetes cluster.
The Object ID of Web Application Routing.
